value.title: Skills needed for a Power BI Developer
value.excerpt: So you want to become a Power BI Developer, and wonder what skills you need to learn, what are the best resources to learn from, and where to start? This is an article and video explaining those in detail and helping you in your journey to become a Power BI Developer. Find all the links in my blog article
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Yau0tVP0H8U" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: SUM vs SUMX What is the Difference of the two DAX Functions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Sum and Sumx are functions that often founded to be misleading for many Power BI users. As both functions are doing the aggregation, it seems a bit confusing what is the actual difference between these two. There are many blog posts and articles about each function. I always explain the difference with
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-3snD-VOqik" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kAniA_N7sB8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Computing sales made to customers before and after a period
value.excerpt: How to manipulate the filter context to create a report with the sales made to a specific customer segment, before and after a selected month. Article and download: https://sql.bi/760164?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iDBXnx5r4XQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Controlling drillthrough in Excel PivotTables connected to Power BI or Analysis Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to customize the drillthrough experience in Excel PivotTables connected to Power BI datasets or Analysis Services databases. Article and download: https://sql.bi/726459?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/h4woNGohUBo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. Different users can have different default values, and yet retain the full capability to select different values. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717242?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZHlC55APxPs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Distinguishing HASONEVALUE from ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: This video describes the differences between HASONEVALUE and ISINSCOPE, which are two useful DAX functions to control the filters and the grouping that are active in a report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662962?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/8UNNo233eFc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Finding the slowest measure in a DAX query
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to find the slowest measure in a DAX query produced by a Power BI report. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ltO1tDL9HQ0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Header-detail vs star schema models in Tabular and Power BI
value.excerpt: Compare header/detail models and star schemas: even though a star schema might require a few ETL steps and some coding, it is always the best modeling option. Article and download: https://sql.bi/728493?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/R8SaJ__UMHI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Highlighting the minimum and maximum values in a Power BI matrix
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use DAX and conditional formatting together to highlight the minimum and maximum values in a matrix in Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662096?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5yAylZKL0lE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to enable the Single Value option in a Power BI slicer
value.excerpt: This video describes how to enable the Single Value slicer option in Power BI by adding additional metadata to the model with Tabular Editor. Article and download: https://sql.bi/728090?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Tyv0lDUK2rw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing DEFINE COLUMN in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE COLUMN statement in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/696234/?aff=yt This syntax has been introduced in DAX since December 2020 and can be used in DAX queries only.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/wBs0p7kPElU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Introducing DEFINE TABLE in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE TABLE statement in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/696241/?aff=yt This syntax has been introduced in DAX since December 2020 and can be used in DAX queries only.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XCHXrhWfK5s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hrhEjg9yYvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Optimizing conditions involving blank values in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how blank values in a DAX conditional expression can affect its query plan and how to apply possible optimizations to improve performance in these cases. Article and download: https://sql.bi/483918?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Kb-AqMQzLAk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Optimizing DAX with cardinality estimation computing working days
value.excerpt: Learn how to estimate the cardinality of iterators computing the number of working days between two dates. Article and download: https://sql.bi/699689/?aff=yt  This is an important skill when optimizing DAX code.   How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zMKgjiqjATg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/dtFq-TvGL1M" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Optimizing LASTNONBLANK and LASTNONBLANKVALUE calculations
value.excerpt: Learn LASTNONBLANK, LASTNONBLANKVALUE, and similar DAX functions, including patterns for performance optimization. Article and download: https://sql.bi/626763/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/pyLoeVfAVXU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the “sort by column” feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0peKz7XjEdw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: USERELATIONSHIP in calculated columns
value.excerpt: Learn why USERELATIONSHIP is easy to work with in measures, but it can be challenging and give you inaccurate results when used in calculated columns. Article and download: {short_related_link}?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/k6uSnlr62fg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6gCk4UoOw0g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JS-K2faCiCc" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: 5 New Features I Love – Coming Soon to Power BI
value.excerpt: You may already be aware (but then again, maybe not) that Microsoft shares its plans for upcoming new features for the Power Platform every 6 months, and Power BI forms a subset of that plan. The next plan is called Power Platform Release Plan 2021 Wave 2. It takes a [...]Read More »

value.title: 5 Productivity Benefits of Tabular Editor 3
value.excerpt: Tabular Editor is a Power BI Tabular Modelling productivity tool developed by Daniel Otykier. I blogged about Version 2 of the Tabular Editor in this article here. The 3rd edition of Tabular Editor has just been released, and it is a major upgrade from version 2. TE 3 is not [...]Read More »

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More »

value.title: Building a Matrix with Asymmetrical Columns and Rows in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a few articles that are related to this topic (articles that utilise this same technique to solve a problem), but never before have I explained the stand alone concept of how to build a visual with asymmetrical columns and rows in Power BI.  Let me explain with [...]Read More »

value.title: Building a P&L in Power BI – Part 2 (Percentages)
value.excerpt: I blogged about how to Build a P&L With Power BI back in April 2020, and the response from my readers was great. Several people asked how to add percentages such as % of net sales revenue, % gross profit, etc. into the P&L. I decided therefore to do a [...]Read More »

value.title: Building A Power BI (COVID) Report From Scratch
value.excerpt: As promised, today I am sharing with you the process I went through to build the COVID report I shared in my last article. One of the best ways to learn and improve your Power BI skills is to practice. The best way to practice is to find something you [...]Read More »

value.title: Calendar Over Run in Power BI
value.excerpt: This is an update to an article that I wrote back in 2019. This time around I created a video to go along with the written explanation and documentation below. You can jump straight to the video below if you prefer that medium. What is Calendar Over Run? Consider the [...]Read More »

value.title: Case Fatality Rate for COVID in Australia
value.excerpt: I am writing an off-topic article today but I promise I will circle back later in the week with a follow up article bringing it back on topic. In this article, I am going to share a COVID report I built today, and later in the week I will post [...]Read More »
